definition: two simultaneous happy events in the family
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: That means you'll have double happiness.
sentences.chinese: 那就說明你會雙喜臨門唄。

sentences.english: For Erson, 51, it's a double blessing.
sentences.chinese: 對51歲的爾森來說，這是一件雙喜臨門的事。

definition: to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
to learn of (an event)/to hear about (sth)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
full moon/first full moon after birth (i.e. entering the second month)
